resource.name: Revitalization - Consumer Sentiment Index
resource.description: This dataset measures the degree of optimism that consumers feel about the overall state of the economy and their personal finances. This data is generated through a survey conducted by the University of Michigan to produce the University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment Index (UMCSI).  The data is normalized to have a value of 100 in 1966 allowing for an illustration of changes in consumer sentiment over time. The data represents the UMCSI for the 12 state North Central region of the United States, which includes Michigan. More information can be found here.

resource.name: Participatory Budgeting Idea Catalog
resource.description: List of all ideas submitted through Grand Rapids' Participatory Budgeting initiative. This does not imply that all ideas meet ARPA qualifications or have been determined to be feasible. These determinations will be made when the project submission window closes in May, 2022.
columns_name: If there is a specific location, please share it here. This could be a specific address, street, intersection or neighborhood. If there is not a specific location, skip to the next question.
Please tell us what project category your idea best aligns with.
If the program or project idea you're submitting takes place in a specific Ward, please select that Ward below. If it is not specific to a particular Ward, skip to the next question.
Would you say there is some historical relevance to your idea? For instance, does it preserve important historical sites or address historical inequities in some meaningful way?
How do you think the community might benefit from this project?
How does this project support the ARPA category you selected?
What Ward do you currently live in?
Please provide a short name for your project

Do you know if this idea has been previously presented or included in a neighborhood event, meeting or plan? This could include area-specific plans (ASPs), Corridor Improvement Authorities (CIA) or city-hosted events.
Use the space below to explain your project idea.
